info.game_comments:
2016 Teen Tournament semifinal game 1.
From DAR Constitution Hall in Washington, D.C.

double_jeopardy_round: ENDANGERED ANIMALS AT THE SMITHSONIAN'S NATIONAL ZOO

(1, 1).clue: We're going to the western part of this continent

(2, 1).clue: In "Steelheart" this Midwestern American city has been transformed into steel; even Lake Michigan has turned to metal

(3, 1).clue: It's the ceremony at which a father is supposed to give away his daughter

(4, 1).clue: "Yeah I know that I let you down, is it too late to say I'm sorry now?"

(5, 1).clue: I'm going to grab some this, meaning sleep

(6, 1).clue: A combination of African & Irish traditional dancing may be the source of this style of dance

(1, 2).clue: We'll spend the official currency, the CFA this, remember that Togo was formerly French Togoland

(2, 2).clue: Book 2 of "The Lunar Chronicles" is "Scarlet", which was inspired by this fairy tale & features a street fighter named Wolf

(3, 2).clue: This ceremony for babies often includes baptism & naming

(4, 2).clue: "Are we out of the woods yet? Are we out of the woods yet? Are we out of the woods yet?"

(5, 2).clue: The opposing team doesn't score while losing

(6, 2).clue: Drums called pahu help provide the rhythm for this sensuous dance of the Pacific

(1, 3).clue: We can watch this popular sport in which Togo qualified for its first World Cup in 2006

(2, 3).clue: Meg & Charles Murry travel the universe with Mrs. Whatsit, Mrs. Who & Mrs. Which in this 1962 novel

(3, 3).clue: May 2015 speakers at this ceremony included Denzel Washington at Dillard University

(4, 3).clue: "I'm so sick of that same old love, my body's had enough"

(5, 3).clue: A courtesy one may take you from the airport to a rental car

(6, 3).clue: These insects do a "dance" to communicate the location of distant flowers & nectar

(1, 4).clue: Togo has a high rate of malaria, so we'll bring the netting seen here to keep this creature out

(2, 4).clue: "Mother" & "Father" are forbidden terms in this novel by Aldous Huxley

(3, 4).clue: 2-word term for what gets thrown out on Opening Day at Nationals Park

(4, 4).clue: "And they say she's in the Class A team, suck in her daydream, been this way since 18"

(5, 4).clue: The Groovebook app delivers a monthly photo book, courtesy of this memory-preserving website

(6, 4).clue: Edgar Degas, who painted the dancer seen here, was part of this artistic movement

(1, 5).clue: Perhaps we'll see the festival of 'Id al-Fitr, marking the end of this Muslim holy month

(2, 5).clue: "The Infinite Sea" is the follow-up to this book in which Cassie Sullivan has survived an alien invasion

(3, 5).clue: With special permission, your group or club may lay this circle of flowers at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier

(4, 5).clue: "This is my fight song, take back my life song"

(5, 5).clue: One who rarely leaves home, confined by introversion or illness

(6, 5).clue: The samba is a dance of this largest South American nation

(1, 1).clue: The "Star Trek" universe: Mr. Spock's emotionless race

(4, 1).clue: It's a ball support in both golf & football

(5, 1).clue: She was queen when William Shakespeare was born & died when he was almost 40

(6, 1).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew presents from Smithsonian's National Zoo in Washington, D.C..)  They're symbols of peace & friendship, & sadly, in their native China, only about 1,800 giant pandas remain in the wild, primarily due to destruction of the forests that provide this tall, woody grass that these guys can each eat over 50 pounds of daily

(1, 2).clue: In "Bridge of Spies": the city where the bridge is located

(3, 2).clue: Illegally avoiding paying the government on state, federal or local levels

(5, 2).clue: She sponsored Columbus' voyages, bringing wealth & power to Spain

(6, 2).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew presents from Smithsonian's National Zoo in Washington, D.C.)  Without native mammals present, kiwis thrived for over 35 million years, but today they're endangered & facing extinction, largely because they're flightless and can't escape from introduced predators in this, their native country

(1, 3).clue: Michael Fassbender plays an "Apple" grower: the title

(2, 3).clue: On "The Simpsons" it comes between C. & Burns

(3, 3).clue: 2-word term for stealing & using someone's personal information to commit fraud

(5, 3).clue: This queen consort of Louis XVI inspired many women to emulate her extravagant style

(6, 3).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew presents from Smithsonian's National Zoo in Washington, D.C..)  Known since ancient times & extinct in the wild until recent reintroductions, the scimitar-horned oryx is noted for its long, curved horns; if one breaks off, it doesn't grow back, which may have inspired the myth of this legendary creature

(1, 4).clue: "The Blind Side": the Best Actress winner

(2, 4).clue: Ancient Greek site of athletic fame

(3, 4).clue: A federal statute fighting this type of crime includes assault motivated by disability, gender identity & sexual orientation

(5, 4).clue: Also known as Makeda, in the Bible she visited King Solomon

(6, 4).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew presents from Smithsonian's National Zoo in Washington, D.C..)  With fewer than 50,000 left in the wild, Asian elephants, like their larger African cousins, are facing extinction due to habitat loss, human-elephant conflict, & this crime, the illegal killing, capturing, or stealing or wildlife

(3, 5).clue: A word for taking over a plane led to this word for taking someone's automobile

(4, 5).clue: It can precede bass or bed

(5, 5).clue: 14th century Queen Margaret I of Denmark took on this commercial league to win back coastal strongholds

(6, 5).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew presents from Smithsonian's National Zoo in Washington, D.C..)  The Sumatran tiger is the smallest subspecies & has the narrowest stripes; largely due to habitat loss & the illegal wildlife trade, there are as few as 400 left on their native island in this country

(0, 0).clue: In a British novel this young character's last words are, "Which is better--to have rules & agree, or to hunt & kill?"
